original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i yul gyi rnam pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dag bzod pa'i shes rab sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i yul gyi rnam pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dag bzod pa'i shes rab sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of acceptance of those is the acceptance of the knowledge of the teaching on suffering.

original: de sngon du btang ba 'am des nye bar bstan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bzod pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de sngon du btang ba 'am des nye bar bstan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bzod pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ste /

original: zag pa med pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the attainment of nirvana by the uncontaminated path.

original: de mchog ces sangs rgyas gsungs zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de dngos po thams cad kyi mchog yin no zhes sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: de mchog ces sangs rgyas gsungs zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de dngos po thams cad kyi mchog yin no zhes sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bsngags pa ste /
translated: That is the supreme, the Buddha has said is the praise by the Buddha Bhagavans that the nirvana of acceptance is the supreme of all things.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du ma yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du ma yin la /
translated: The nirvana attained by the mundane path is not permanent.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du ma yin pa nyid kyis gnod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du ma yin pa nyid kyis gnod pa med pa ste /
translated: Nirvana attained by the uncontaminated path is not harmed, because it is not impermanent.

original: zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of peace.

original: ji ltar na bzod pa'i dka' thub dam pa yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar na bzod pa'i dka' thub dam pa yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How is patience the highest austerity?

original: rab tu byung ba gzhan la gnod pa dang // gzhan la 'tshe ba dge sbyong ma yin no //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gzhan la gnod pa dang // gzhan la 'tshe ba dge sbyong ma yin no // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The ascetic who harms others and is violent toward others is not a monk.

original: gzhan la gnod pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyis gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyis gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: Harming others is mental harm.

original: gzhan la 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni lus ngag gnyis kyis 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni lus ngag gnyis kyis 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Violence toward others is physical and verbal violence.

original: dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The monk is one whose nature is peaceful.

original: 'di ltar bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: gang gi phyir gzhan la gnod pa dang / gzhan la 'tshe ba rab tu byung ba'i dge sbyong rdzogs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bzod pa ni dka' thub dam pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan la gnod pa dang / gzhan la 'tshe ba rab tu byung ba'i dge sbyong rdzogs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bzod pa ni dka' thub dam pa yin la /
translated: Since the ascetic who harms others and is violent toward others is not a monk, therefore patience is the highest austerity.

original: de'i 'bras bu bzod pas thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang mchog yin pas de'i phyir rab tu byung bas bzod pa bsten par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu bzod pas thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang mchog yin pas de'i phyir rab tu byung bas bzod pa bsten par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The nirvana attained through the result of patience is also supreme. Therefore, it is taught that those who have gone forth should rely on patience.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa gtsug tor can gyi slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa gtsug tor can gyi slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The disciples of the Transcendent Conqueror Śikhin also had minor faults.

original: gzhan gyis nyes pa sgrogs pa mang ba tsam zhig yod pas de dag gi nyes pa de yongs su spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor @145b bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing bton par gyur te /🔽mig ldan 'gro ba yod pa yis //

translated: Because they had the fault of merely speaking of the faults of others a lot, in order to completely abandon that fault, that Transcendent Conqueror taught this Sūtra on Individual Liberation in brief, to be recited every half month.🔽Just as a person with eyes

original: nyam nga ba dag ji bzhin du //
analyzed: nyam nga ba dag ji bzhin du //
translated: knows to avoid dangerous paths,

original: mkhas ba 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'dir //
analyzed: mkhas ba 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'dir //

original: sdig pa dag ni yongs su sdong //

original: skur ba mi gdab gnod mi bya //
analyzed: skur ba mi gdab gnod mi bya //

analyzed: so sor thar ba 'ang bsdam par bya //

original: zas kyi tshod kyang rig par bya //
analyzed: zas kyi tshod kyang rig par bya //

original: bas mtha'i gnas su gnas par bya //
analyzed: bas mtha'i gnas su gnas par bya //

analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la yang dag sbyor // 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
translated: One should apply oneself to the higher mind.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.🔽Therein,

original: de la mig ldan 'gro ba yod pa yis //
analyzed: de la mig ldan 'gro ba yod pa yis //
translated: One who has eyes and goes about

original: nyam da ba dag ji bzhin du //
analyzed: nyam da ba dag ji bzhin du //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mi mig dang ldan pa long ba ma yin pa 'gro ba yod pa /

translated: should avoid the dangerous places, uneven ground, thorns, snakes, etc., which are causes of suffering.

original: mkhas pa 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'dir //
analyzed: mkhas pa 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'dir //
translated: The wise, in this world of living beings,

original: sdig pa dag ni yongs su spong //
analyzed: sdig pa dag ni yongs su spong //

analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te mkhas pa blo dang ldan pa rtog pa dang sel nus pa yang 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'dir 'khor ba 'di na sdig pa gang dag yin pa de dag yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: The wise, the intelligent, those who can imagine and eliminate, should avoid the sinful in this world of living beings, in this world.

original: ji ltar sdig pa de dag yongs su spang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sdig pa de dag yongs su spang bar bya zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir / skur pa mi gdab gnod mi bya // zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs te /

analyzed: skur pa mi gdab ces bya ba ni gzhan la yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa yang rung bas skur ba mi gad ba pa'o //
translated: Do not revile means: do not revile others, whether they are real or not.

translated: Do not harm means: do not harm others by beating them, by harsh words, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should observe the vow of individual liberation.

original: so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig kyal pa dang / dag rtsub mo la sogs pa spangs pa'i sdom pa dge slong la sogs pa'i ris bdun po dag go //
analyzed: so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig kyal pa dang / dag rtsub mo la sogs pa spangs pa'i sdom pa dge slong la sogs pa'i ris bdun po dag go //
translated: Individual liberation means: the vow of abandoning killing, stealing, unchastity, lying, slander, idle talk, harsh speech, etc. It is the seven groups of monks, etc.

original: de bsdam par bya ba ni yongs su bsrung bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bsdam par bya ba ni yongs su bsrung bar bya ba ste /

translated: It should be understood that the cultivation of superior morality is twofold: the characteristic of turning away and the characteristic of practice.

original: zas kyi tshod kyang rig par bya //
analyzed: zas kyi tshod kyang rig par bya //
translated: One should know the measure in eating.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dge slong rnams kyis zas rung ba 'di la zas kyi tshod kyang shes par bya ste /
translated: This means that monks should know the measure in eating this allowable food.

analyzed: ji tsam gyis lus lci ba dang rmya bar mi 'gyur ba de tsam gyis tshod yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: One should know the measure by just how much the body does not become heavy and sluggish.

original: bas mtha'i gnas su gnas par bya //
analyzed: bas mtha'i gnas su gnas par bya //
translated: One should dwell in a remote place.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bas mtha' mthar gyur pa gnas dben par gnas par bya ba ste / 'dis lus dang yul legs @146a * //

analyzed: par mthun pa dag gis lam bsgom pa'i tshogs bstan par shes par bya'o //

original: lhag pa'i sems la yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la yang dag sbyor //
translated: One should apply oneself to superior mind.

translated: The training in superior mind is the training in superior mind, which is the purification of mind, by which the mind is purified of the obscurations of attachment and the obscurations of ignorance.

translated: In this respect, correct application is the correct application of the training in superior mind and the training in superior wisdom should be understood as being indicated.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas mdor bstan pa 'di ni tshogs dang bcas pa'i lam bstan pa yin te /

translated: They generated the meditative absorptions with craving, and in order to completely eliminate that fault, that Transcendent Lord condensed this Sūtra on the Discipline like this and recited it every half month:

original: lhag pa'i sems la bag bya ste //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la bag bya ste //
translated: “Be careful with the higher mind.

original: thub ba'i thub gzhi rnams la bslab //🔽nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa'i //
analyzed: thub ba'i thub gzhi rnams la bslab // nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa'i //
translated: Train in the bases of the Sage’s discipline.🔽The Protector is free from sorrow,

original: skyob pa mya ngan med pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyob pa mya ngan med pa yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: always mindful of complete peace.”

original: de la lhag pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag go //
translated: There, the “higher mind” is the four meditative absorptions.

original: de la bag bya ste zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang nga rgyal dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa spang zhing bag gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la bag bya ste zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang nga rgyal dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa spang zhing bag gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “Be careful with it” means “Abandon craving, pride, and the over-estimation of your morality and spiritual disciplines, and be careful.”

original: spang ba bstan nas blang ba bsten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spang ba bstan nas blang ba bsten pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the abandonment, in order to teach the adoption, he says:

original: thub pa'i thub gzhi rnams la bslab //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thub pa'i thub gzhi rnams la bslab // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Train in the bases of the Muni's training.

original: thub pa zhes bya ba ni mkhyen pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa zhes bya ba ni mkhyen pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The Muni is one who possesses knowledge.

original: yang dang yang du mdzad pa'i phyir thub pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: yang dang yang du mdzad pa'i phyir thub pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Muni is the Buddha Bhagavan, because he acts again and again.

original: thub pa de'i thub gzhi ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag ste /
analyzed: thub pa de'i thub gzhi ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag ste /
translated: The bases of the Muni's training are the four noble truths,

original: gang dag gis thub pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis thub pa skyed pa'o //
translated: because they generate the Muni.

original: de rnams la bslab pa ni mchog tu bslab cing nan tan gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de rnams la bslab pa ni mchog tu bslab cing nan tan gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Train in them means: train in them supremely, and practice them. This is the meaning.

original: de la bslab na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la bslab na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one trains in them, what will occur?

original: 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /🔽nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa'i //
analyzed: 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir / nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa'i //
translated: In order to teach the result, he says:🔽The protector is free from sorrow,

original: skyob pa mya ngan med pa yin //🔽zhes bya sba gsungs te /
analyzed: skyob pa mya ngan med pa yin // zhes bya sba gsungs te /
translated: always mindful, and completely pacified.

original: nye bar zhi ba dang rtag tu dran pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis skyob pa nyid du bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba dang rtag tu dran pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis skyob pa nyid du bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the protector is taught by the two: complete pacification and always being mindful.

original: de la nye bar zhi bar zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de la nye bar zhi bar zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: Here, fully pacified means equipoise,

original: lus dang ngag gnyis kyis bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gnyis kyis bsdams pa'o //
translated: and restrained in body and speech means restraint.

original: rtag tu dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Always mindful means always placing mindfulness in the foundations of mindfulness.

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems rjes su bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems rjes su bsrung ba'o //
translated: Protected means protecting one's own mind.

original: mya ngan med pa yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni skye ba zad pa bstan te /🔽mya ngan las @147a * //
analyzed: mya ngan med pa yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni skye ba zad pa bstan te / mya ngan las @147a * //
translated: Without sorrow shows the end of birth.

original: 'das pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this is nirvana.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur te /
translated: The disciples of the Blessed Thus-Gone Kāśyapa also had minor faults.

original: sbyin pa la mgus pa dang dgra mang bar blta ba tsam zhig yod pas de dag gi nyes pa de yongs su spang pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des mthar thug pa'i chos bstan pas so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing
analyzed: sbyin pa la mgus pa dang dgra mang bar blta ba tsam zhig yod pas de dag gi nyes pa de yongs su spang pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des mthar thug pa'i chos bstan pas so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te zla ba phyed phyed cing
translated: They had only a slight lack of faith in generosity and saw many enemies. To completely eliminate those faults, that Blessed One, through this ultimate Dharma teaching, concisely taught this Sūtra on Individual Liberation every half-month.

original: bton par gyur te /
analyzed: bton par gyur te /
translated: It is stated:

original: sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
analyzed: sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //
translated: By giving, merit increases.

original: legs bsdams dgra sogs mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: legs bsdams dgra sogs mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By being well restrained, one does not become an enemy, etc.

original: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong //🔽nyon mongs zad pas myang na 'da' //
analyzed: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong // nyon mongs zad pas myang na 'da' //
translated: By being virtuous, one abandons evil.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By exhausting the afflictions, one attains nirvana.

original: de la sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa byed pa'i mi ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa byed pa'i mi ste /
translated: Here, the one called “giver” is the person who gives.

original: des ni longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can gyi bsod nams kyi las rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can gyi bsod nams kyi las rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the meritorious action that has the result of wealth increases.

original: tshul khrims legs par bsdams pas ni dgra sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims legs par bsdams pas ni dgra sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By being well restrained in morality, one does not become an enemy, etc.

original: tshul khrims kyis dgra'i rgyu gsod pa dang / rku ba dang / bud med la chags pa la sogs ba mi bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis dgra'i rgyu gsod pa dang / rku ba dang / bud med la chags pa la sogs ba mi bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because morality does not generate the causes of enemies, such as killing, stealing, and attachment to women, etc.🔽By being virtuous, one abandons evil.

original: dge slong dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi thob pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi thob pa ste /
translated: By being endowed with the four absorptions, one abandons evil.

original: des ni 'dod pa la spyod pa'i sdig pa khong khro ba dang phrag dog dang / khro ba la sogs pa rnam par smin pa mi 'dod par 'gyur pa dag yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni 'dod pa la spyod pa'i sdig pa khong khro ba dang phrag dog dang / khro ba la sogs pa rnam par smin pa mi 'dod par 'gyur pa dag yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, one abandons the evil of the realm of desire, which is the anger, envy, wrath, etc., whose results are not desired.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su zad pas ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i myang na las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su zad pas ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i myang na las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the noble path, one obtains the Nirvana with and without remainder, through the complete exhaustion of all the defilements.

original: de bas na sbyin pa ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu can yin pas de la gus par mi bya zhing dgra mang ba ni sdom brtson dang mi mthun pa yin pas de mi bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu can yin pas de la gus par mi bya zhing dgra mang ba ni sdom brtson dang mi mthun pa yin pas de mi bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, generosity has the fruit of cyclic existence; therefore, one should not respect it. And, since having many enemies is not in accord with the life of striving, one should not do it. This is the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'i bstan pa la chu bur ma byung ba'i tshe na de'i slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'i bstan pa la chu bur ma byung ba'i tshe na de'i slob ma rnams kyang nyes pa chung bar gyur pas /
translated: When the blisters had not yet appeared in the doctrine of the Lord Sakyamuni, the disciples of that doctrine had little fault.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bton par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ltar mdor bsdus te tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bton par 'gyur te /
translated: The Blessed One summarized this Prātimokṣa Sūtra for them in three verses:

original: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
translated: Do not commit any evil,

original: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
analyzed: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
translated: Cultivate virtue well,

original: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
translated: Fully tame one's mind—

original: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
translated: Restraint of the body is excellent,

original: ngag gi sdom pa 'ang legs pa yin //
analyzed: ngag gi sdom pa 'ang legs pa yin //
translated: Restraint of speech is also excellent,

original: yid kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
translated: Restraint of the mind is excellent,

original: thams cad du ni sdom pa legs //
analyzed: thams cad du ni sdom pa legs //
translated: Restraint in all ways is excellent.

original: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol //
translated: Fully liberated from all suffering,

original: ngag rnams bsrung zhing yid kyis rab @147b bsdams te //
analyzed: ngag rnams bsrung zhing yid kyis rab @147b bsdams te //
translated: Guarding speech, fully restraining the mind,

original: lus kyis mi dge ba dag mi byed cing //
analyzed: lus kyis mi dge ba dag mi byed cing //
translated: Not committing any non-virtue with the body,

original: las lam gsum po 'di dag rab sbyangs na //
analyzed: las lam gsum po 'di dag rab sbyangs na //
translated: Having fully trained in these three paths of action,

original: drang srong gsungs pa'i lam ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: drang srong gsungs pa'i lam ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: One attains the path taught by the Sage.

original: zhes bya'o // de la sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de la sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste /
translated: Regarding that, Do not commit any evil means

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the training in superior morality.

original: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
analyzed: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
translated: One should perfect the wholesome.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa bstan te /
translated: This verse shows the training in superior wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa ni thams cad spangs pa ni don dam pa'i dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni thams cad spangs pa ni don dam pa'i dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The abandonment of all the afflictions is the ultimate wholesome.

original: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
translated: One should thoroughly tame one's own mind.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the training in superior mind.

original: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
translated: Restraint of the body is excellent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs sdom pa rnam pa bzhis ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs sdom pa rnam pa bzhis ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the perfection of morality through the four kinds of restraint.

original: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol //
translated: One is completely liberated from all suffering.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims gyi skyes bu'i rtsal gyis 'bras bu thag ring ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims gyi skyes bu'i rtsal gyis 'bras bu thag ring ba bstan to //

analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims kyis sdug bsngal kun las rab tu grol bar 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir / ngag rnams bsrung zhing yid kyis rab bsdams te //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Guard your speech and restrain your mind.

original: gang gi phyir tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas ngan song gsum gyi sgo sbyangs shing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pas ngan song gsum gyi sgo sbyangs shing /
translated: Because those who are perfect in ethics have purified the door to the three lower realms

original: 'phags pa'i lam thob pa de sdug bsngal thams cad las grol ba de'i phyir 'di ni tshul khrims kyi skyes bu'i rtsal gyis 'bras bu thag ring ba yin no //

translated: and attained the noble path, they are liberated from all suffering. Therefore, this is the distant result of the power of ethics.

analyzed: de ltar mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas par bstan pa dag gis sangs rgyas bdun gyi so sor thar pa gdon pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the individual liberation of the seven buddhas in brief and in detail,🔽now, in order to teach the importance of practice by way of a concluding summary,

original: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas nan tan bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas nan tan bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

analyzed: 'khor ba 'jig dang gser thub 'od srungs dang // sh'akya thub pa goo ta ma lha yi lha //

analyzed: mi 'dul kha lo bsgyur ba bla na med //
translated: the unsurpassed trainer of humans to be steered.

analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po skyob pa mchog / sangs rgyas dpa' bo bdun po dag / grags ldan rnams kyis so sor thar //
translated: are the most renowned of those who have attained the state of individual liberation.

original: 'di ni rab tu rgyas par bstan //
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu rgyas par bstan //
translated: This is the extensive teaching.

original: 'di la sangs rgyas rnams dang gang //
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas rnams dang gang //
translated: The Buddhas and

original: sangs rgyas nyan thos rnams kyang gus //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyan thos rnams kyang gus //
translated: the disciples of the Buddhas🔽revere this teaching.

original: 'di la gus dang bcas gyur pas //
analyzed: 'di la gus dang bcas gyur pas //
translated: Therefore, with reverence,

original: 'dus ma byas pa 'ang thob par gyis //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa 'ang thob par gyis //
translated: attain the unconditioned state.

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad par gsum yang dag par sdud pa byed pa smras so // de la sangs rgyas rnam gzigs gtsug tor thams cad skyob // 'khor ba 'jig dang gser thub 'od srungs dang // sh'akya thub pa @148a * //
translated: Thus spoke the compiler of the three verses.

analyzed: zhes bya ba rnams ni sangs rgyas bdun gyi mtshan te go rims bzhin no //
translated: The seven Buddhas are Vipaśyin, Śikhin, Viśvabhū, Krakucchanda, Kanakamuni, Kāśyapa, and Śākyamuni.

original: goo ta ma lha yi lha /
analyzed: goo ta ma lha yi lha /
translated: The Buddha Gautama, the god of gods,

original: mi 'dul kha lo bsgyur ba bla na med //
analyzed: mi 'dul kha lo bsgyur ba bla na med //
translated: the unsurpassed trainer and charioteer of men,🔽is the Blessed One Śākyamuni.

original: ces bya ba dag ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i gdung dang yon tan te /
analyzed: ces bya ba dag ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i gdung dang yon tan te /
translated: His lineage and qualities are as follows:

original: goo tam zhes bya ba ni gdung ste /
analyzed: goo tam zhes bya ba ni gdung ste /
translated: Gautama is the clan name,

original: drang srong goo ta ma'i rgyud yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drang srong goo ta ma'i rgyud yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is of the lineage of the sage Gautama.

original: lha'i lha zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyis grags pa'i sgo nas ni snyigs ma lnga shas che ba'i dus na sems can la phan pa rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i lha zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyis grags pa'i sgo nas ni snyigs ma lnga shas che ba'i dus na sems can la phan pa rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: God of gods is by way of natural fame, because he is the one who completely benefits sentient beings at a time when the five degenerations are on the increase.

original: 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgo nas ni lha rnams kyis kyang zhabs la btud de phyag byas pa'i phyir ro //🔽mi 'dul kha lo bsgyur ba bla na med //🔽ces bya ba ni 'jam pa dang / rtsub po dang / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi 'dul ba rnam pa gsum gyis 'dul ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa'i sgo nas ni lha rnams kyis kyang zhabs la btud de phyag byas pa'i phyir ro // mi 'dul kha lo bsgyur ba bla na med // ces bya ba ni 'jam pa dang / rtsub po dang / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi 'dul ba rnam pa gsum gyis 'dul ba /
translated: By way of worldly fame, it is because the gods bow down to his feet and pay homage to him.🔽 Unsurpassed trainer of men to be tamed is because he trains the three types of beings to be tamed, who are gentle, rough, and a combination of both.

original: skyes bu rta lta bu dag phyin ci ma log par 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu rta lta bu dag phyin ci ma log par 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He trains them without error, like a horse trainer.

original: 'jig rten mgon po zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i mgon po ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i mgon po ste /
translated: Protector of the world is because he is the protector of the three realms.

original: phan pa dpag tu med pa mdzad pas yongs su skyob par mdzad pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: phan pa dpag tu med pa mdzad pas yongs su skyob par mdzad pa'i phyir ro//
translated: He is the one who completely protects by means of immeasurable benefit.

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni mnga' dbang gi chos thams cad la dbang phyug brnyes pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni mnga' dbang gi chos thams cad la dbang phyug brnyes pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The term protector means that he has attained mastery over all things through his sovereignty, or

analyzed: 'dul ba'i skye bo dus las mi yol bas yongs su skyob par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that he protects the beings to be trained by not passing beyond the time to do so.

analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni gtso bo ste /
